title: User Management Help
content: This page allows you to manage all users in the system. You can search, add, edit, and delete users.

sections.title: Searching for Users
sections.content:
Quick Search: Use the search bar at the top to quickly find users by username, name, or email.

Advanced Search: Click the filter icon to access advanced search options where you can filter by role, department, and status.

sections.title: Adding a New User
sections.content:
1. Click the Add button in the toolbar

2. Fill in the required fields (username, password, name, email)

3. Select the appropriate role and department

4. Click Save to create the user

sections.title: Editing User Information
sections.content:
1. Find the user in the list

2. Click the Edit icon in the actions column

3. Update the necessary information

4. Click Save to apply changes

sections.title: Deleting Users
sections.content:
1. Select one or more users using the checkboxes

2. Click the Delete button in the toolbar

3. Confirm the deletion in the dialog that appears

Note: You cannot delete your own account.

sections.title: Exporting Data
sections.content: You can export user data to Excel or PDF format using the export buttons in the toolbar.

faqs.question: How do I reset a user's password?
faqs.answer: Edit the user and enter a new password in the password field. Leave it blank if you don't want to change the password.

faqs.question: What are the different user roles?
faqs.answer: There are three roles: Admin (full access), Manager (can manage users in their department), and User (limited access).

faqs.question: How many users can I select and delete at once?
faqs.answer: You can select and delete multiple users at once using the checkboxes. There is no limit to the number of users you can delete simultaneously.

relatedLinks.title: User Roles and Permissions
relatedLinks.description: Learn more about user roles and permissions

relatedLinks.title: Security Settings
relatedLinks.description: Configure security settings for user accounts
